title: JSON Guide Demo - All Block Types

blocks.content:
# JSON Guide Demo

This guide demonstrates **all block types** supported by the JSON guide format. Use this as a reference for creating your own guides.

## Markdown Blocks

Markdown blocks support:

- **Bold text** and *italic text*
- `Inline code` snippets
- [Links](https://grafana.com) to external resources
- Ordered and unordered lists

### Code Blocks

You can include fenced code blocks with syntax highlighting:

```json
{
  "type": "markdown",
  "content": "Your markdown content here"
}
```

```promql
rate(http_requests_total[5m])
```

## Interactive Blocks

Interactive blocks let users interact with the Grafana UI. Each has **Show me** and **Do it** buttons.

### Show-Only Mode

Use `showOnly: true` for educational steps that only highlight without requiring action:
This is a **show-only** step - notice there's no "Do it" button, just "Show me".
blocks.tooltip: Show-only mode is perfect for guided tours and educational content where you want to **point out** UI elements without requiring user action.

blocks.content:
### Highlight Action

Highlight an element to show the user where something is:
This **highlight** action shows users where the Dashboards menu item is.
blocks.tooltip: The `highlight` action adds a visual indicator around the target element. Great for pointing out UI locations!

blocks.content: This step is **skippable** - users can skip it if the element isn't available.
blocks.tooltip: Skippable steps are useful when elements may not always be visible or accessible.
blocks.hint: This hint appears when the step cannot be completed

blocks.content:
### Button Action

The `button` action clicks a button by its text content:
The **button** action can click buttons by their text. Navigate to Dashboards first to see this in action.
blocks.tooltip: Button actions find elements by text content and click them.

blocks.content:
### Formfill Action

The `formfill` action enters text into input fields:
The **formfill** action types text into input fields. The `targetvalue` specifies what to type.
blocks.tooltip: Formfill is perfect for demonstrating search boxes, form inputs, and text areas.

blocks.content:
## Multistep Blocks

Multistep blocks execute a sequence of actions **automatically** when the user clicks "Do it":
This **multistep** block will highlight two menu items in sequence automatically.

## Guided Blocks

Guided blocks highlight elements and **wait for the user** to perform the action:
This **guided** block will highlight menu items and wait for you to click them. Try clicking each highlighted element!

## Section Blocks with Requirements

Sections can have **requirements** that must be met before they become accessible:
This section is only accessible to **admin users**.
blocks.tooltip: The `is-admin` requirement checks if the current user has admin privileges.

blocks.content:
## ðŸŽ‰ That's All the Block Types!

You've now seen every block type supported by JSON guides:

| Block Type | Description |
|------------|-------------|
| `markdown` | Formatted text with headings, lists, code |
| `html` | Raw HTML for migration/custom content |
| `image` | Embedded images |
| `video` | YouTube or native video embeds |
| `section` | Container for grouped interactive steps |
| `interactive` | Single-action step (highlight, button, formfill, hover) |
| `multistep` | Automated sequence of actions |
| `guided` | User-performed sequence with detection |

**Pro tip:** Start with `markdown` blocks for content, use `section` blocks to group related interactive steps, and choose between `multistep` (automated) and `guided` (user-performed) based on your learning objectives.
